Yes, there are several steps that can be taken to ensure compliance with the Geneva Convention:

1. Strengthening enforcement mechanisms: Improving the enforcement mechanisms of the Geneva Convention can go a long way in ensuring compliance. This includes increasing the authority of international organizations to investigate and prosecute violations, as well as increasing penalties for violators.

2. Raising public awareness: Raising public awareness about the principles of the Geneva Convention and the consequences of violating it can also help to ensure compliance. This can be done through education and media campaigns.

3. Creating accountability: Holding those who violate the Geneva Convention accountable for their actions is another way to ensure compliance. This includes investigating and prosecuting individuals and groups responsible for violations, as well as imposing sanctions on countries that continue to violate the convention.

4. Strengthening monitoring mechanisms: Strengthening monitoring mechanisms can also help to ensure compliance. This includes increasing access for international organizations and civil society groups to monitor conflict zones and report on any violations of the convention.

It's important to note that ensuring compliance with the Geneva Convention is a collective effort, and all countries and groups must be committed to upholding it.
